sentences.english: Accordingly, the proverb "Drowned by saliva" does not work in America.
sentences.chinese: 所以，在美國，不會有“唾沫淹死人”的俗諺。

definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
all roads lead to Rome/use different means to obtain the same result (idiom)
pinyin: tiao2 tiao2 da4 lu4 tong1 Luo2 ma3

definition: lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
